name: D1.5 - Pre-work site inspection/Existing asset assessment
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - Carry out inspection of existing assets including SWMH01 to assess whether needs replacement
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - The Contractor shall submit to the Engineer an appropriately detailed programme for approval.
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - Engineer to accept the CMP prior to any work commencing on site
Detail - CMP including safety, quality and environmental plans submitted for approval
Frequency - Prior to any work commencing on site
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - Approved by road controlling authority
Detail - Traffic Management Plan to be approved  Pre-construction
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - Heritage induction to be completed
Detail - All personnel who are undertaking work are required to be present at archaeological induction
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - Approved by the Engineer
Detail - The ITP is a Contractor-generated document that outlines the specific inspection and testing requirements used by the Engineer’s Representative to monitor the Contractor’s quality.
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - Enginer approved letter distributed 48hrs prior to construction commencing.
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - All Service Plans onsite and understood by all
Detail - Apply for BeforeUDig, contact anyone not on BeforeUDig
Verification Records - Plans Onsite & Signed ITP
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - Complete the service locate with the authorised people
Detail - Inform Engineer about any significant clash
Verification Records - Plans Onsite & Signed ITP

name: Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - In accordance with NZS 4407
Detail - AP65 Subbase particle size and sand equivalent
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - In accordance with NZS 4407
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - In accordance with NZS 4407
Detail - AP40 Basecourse particle size and sand equivalent
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - In accordance with NZS 4407
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - All pipe to be assessed on delivery to ensure no damage or manufacturing issues
Detail - Should meet the requiremnts of AS/NZS 1260
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - All manholes to be assessed on delivery to ensure no damage or manufacturing issues
Detail - Should meet the requiremnts of AS/NZS 3109
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - Location, depth and foundation
Detail - The manhole shall be constructed to design depth and location, founded on suitable base of material
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - The entry shaft shall not be greater than 500mm
Detail - The entry shaft from the top of the proposed manhole lid to the underside of the MH concrete slab, shall not be greater than 500mm.
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - Manhole step rungs
Detail - The steps shall be installed on the u/s side with the vertical height between steps being 300mm
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - Benching and plastering within the structure
Detail - Confirm benching/plastering completed to appropriate standard
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - External concrete haunching
Detail - Corbel poured to suitable depth and width as per typical details
Detail - Additional volume of concrete required for anti-flotation ballast if corbel volume does not excced 1.2m3
Detail - All pipe protrusions from the manhole shall have flexible joint located within 1 metre of the edge of corbel or manhole structure.

Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - Well graded granular material complying with table G3.AS/NZS 2566.2
Detail - Particle size distribition from material test report
Detail - Bedding material shall be compacted adequately and uniformly and meet the requirements of Type 3 support detail in Fig. D24 and requirements of NZS 2566
Detail - Uncompacted thickness should be less than 200mm
Detail - At every 120m intervals for open trench at every layer
Detail - Basecourse layer shall be minimum of 150mm depth

Detail - At every 6m intervals for open trench
Detail - At every 20m intervals for open trench at every layer

Detail - Kerb and channel to be prepared and staked for laying, and installed as per ICC specification
Detail - Kerb and channel prep to be clegg tested at 10m intervals to a CIV of 35
Detail - Mark out the trench including overcuts
Detail - Enginer's inspection for pipe, concrete pre pour, pre sealing. Minimum 2 working days notice for inspection requirements
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - Ensure as-built data recorded and submitted
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - Producer statement for construction to be supplied to client
D17.2 - WCN and CAR close out
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - To be submitted at completion of works
Detail - Submission to ICC of completion of works in road corridor and close out of CAR
Conformance Criteria (What's Required) - All required documents submitted throughout and at conclusion of project
Detail - All connection sheets, NDM results, encountered services sheets, construction photographs, any outstanding H&S or non conformance reporting
